to fornicate/to defile/adultery/rape

commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

unscrupulous businessman/profiteer/shark/dishonest business
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking

definition: the notion in society that it's better to get ahead in the world by abandoning one's scruples than to suffer poverty/lit. despising poverty but not prostitution (idiom)
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
no poison, no great man (idiom); A great man has to be ruthless.
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
blinded by greed (idiom)
to swindle/to cheat
against one's conscience
lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like

definition: the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
